bibl.title: The Syllabic Name-Lists on O. Crum 525 (UC inv. 32222). Re-edition and Commentary.
bibl.note: O. Crum Copt. 525 = O. Tait Petrie 409 = M.P.E.R., N.S. XVIII, 238. Dendereh, second half of AD 4 or possibly AD 5. The ostracon (evidently Greek, not Coptic) is a typical representative of the traditional use of syllabic name-lists (in this case a list with mythological names) as school exercises, and offers striking similarities to P. Bouriant 1 (= Pack2 2643). - I. Physical description. - II. Diplomatic transcript. - III. Paleographical notes. - IV. Articulated transcript. - V. General discussion. - VI. Commentary.
HUYS Marc and Thomas SCHMIDT, The Syllabic Name-Lists on O. Crum 525 (UC inv. 32222). Re-edition and Commentary.
